name: Geoscience and Remote Sensing Society
Summary: The Geoscience and Remote Sensing Society (GRSS) is a technical Society of the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE). GRSS fosters engagement of its members for the benefit of society through science, engineering, and education.
Description:
The fields of interest of GRSS span science and engineering, and include theory, concepts, and techniques of remote sensing of the Earth, oceans, atmosphere, and space, as well as the processing, interpretation, and dissemination of this information:

  • Remote Sensing of Land and Surface Processes
  • Remote Sensing of the Atmosphere and Oceans
  • Remote Sensing of the Cryosphere
  • Remote Sensing of Solid Earth and Geodynamic Processes
  • Remote Sensing and Mitigation of Natural Disasters
  • Remote Sensing Data Processing Techniques
  • Electromagnetics and Radiative Transfer
  • Sensors, Platforms, and Instruments for Remote Sensing
  • Education, Standards and Policy

Careers: As many tech companies are invested in esports, participating in collegiate esports whether on the competitive or management sides gets students connected with many big names in the industry such as Corsair, Nvidia, Microsoft, Logitech, etc. These companies have initiatives that directly work with collegiate esports organizations and often times recruit within esports spaces. Computer/ Mechanical/ Electrical engineers find advantages with peripheral companies while Computer Science and IT majors (specifically with Game Dev specializations) can connect to developer jobs and game development jobs with ease as companies such as Blizzard and Riot love recruiting esports students.

Summary: The Club allows players to come together and socialize about the game that they care about and love whether it being playing competitively or playing the game casually making friends
Description:
League of Legends has become one of the world's most popular team-based games, having roughly 115 MILLION players.

We, as the Highlanders League of Legends Club, strive to create a welcoming, fun-filled community that brings all NJIT students involved with League of Legends!

Meetings:

General Body Meetings are held (bi-weekly) on Wednesdays at 2:30 PM in collaboration with the NJIT Esports organization. Here, we discuss dates and details for future events as well as take suggestions from the club members.

Want to take your skills to the next level?

Our Division 1 and Division 2 teams represent NJIT's League of Legends club by facing off against other colleges. All teams are given various opportunities to face off against other teams and participate in tournaments.

While some events are for the teams, there are plenty of game nights and other large-scale events available to all members of the club. To create a simulation of the League Championships, we stream most tournaments/events on our twitch channel for viewing pleasure.

Follow our Twitch: https://www.twitch.tv/highlanders_lol
The Community:

Discord is the home of our club members. In this server, members are able to interact with one another through text or voice, play games together, and retrieve information about future events.

Join our discord: https://www.discord.gg/njit and make sure you get the League role!

We'll see YOU on the Rift!

name: Minds+
Summary: Minds+ is The Positive Psychology Club of NJIT.
Description:
Minds+ is The Positive Psychology Club of NJIT.

What is Positive Psychology?

Positive psychology is the scientific study of the strengths and virtues that enable individuals and communities to thrive and grow and not just go through life.

 

Why positive psychology?

Before World War II, psychology had three missions: curing mental illness, making the lives of all people more fulfilling, and identifying and nurturing talent. After the war, most focus was on curing mental illness which helped countless people.

But the downside was that the other two fundamental missions of psychology—making the lives of all people better and nurturing talent—were all but forgotten. These missions were revived with the introduction of positive psychology in 1998.

 

 

Minds+ can be a great way for you to get involved on campus while enriching your life experiences, or just to socialize with like minded people.

Description: The Society of Automotive Engineers (SAE) Aero Design Team at NJIT is an organization that is dedicated to promoting opportunities for students to apply their knowledge to aerospace projects outside the classroom. SAE annually hosts an International Aero Design Competition in which students from dozens of universities are given constraints to design, build, and fly a radio-controlled airplane.

name: NJIT Special Interest Group on Computer–Human Interaction
Summary: NJIT SIGCHI is an ACM special interest group dedicated to encouraging discussions about Human-Computer Interaction. What brings us together is a shared understanding that designing useful and usable technology has the power to transform persons' lives.
Description:
SIGCHI is an interdisciplinary group of computer scientists, software engineers, psychologists, interaction designers, graphic designers, sociologists, multimedia designers, anthropologists, and more. What brings us together is a shared understanding that designing useful and usable technology is an interdisciplinary process, and when done properly it has the power to transform persons' lives. At NJIT, our goal is to create a community of students to spark interest and encourage discussions on human-computer interaction (HCI)
 
We have weekly meetings to focus on professional development related to HCI through discussions, projects, challenges, and more. We also have networking opportunities in the HCI field, potential workshops, seminars, access to various HCI resources, and many other ACM SIGCHI benefits!

name: Kappa Sigma

Description: Kappa Sigma is the largest college social fraternity in the world, originally founded at the University of Virginia in 1869. Kappa Sigma is focused upon the Four Pillars of Fellowship, Leadership, Scholarship, and Service.

name: Sigma Pi Fraternity International
Summary: We are a Greek lettered fraternity that has been on campus since 1938.
Description: Sigma Pi Fraternity was founded in 1897 at Vincennes University, in Vincennes, Indiana. Our Executive Office is located at the historic Mitchell House in Lebanon, Tennessee. The Fraternity is one of the top men’s collegiate organizations in North America, with more than 120 active chapters and colonies in the United States and Canada. With over 100,000 alumni and 5,700 undergraduates; our men strive for excellence by living our core values to promote fellowship, develop character and leadership, advance heightened moral awareness, enable academic achievement, and inspire service. Sigma Pi is the only Greek letter organization with an international philanthropic program, The ACE Project, specifically designed to give back to our host institutions.

name: NJIT Green
Summary: A student-led initiative tasked with promoting new and lasting sustainable practices on both a personal and an institutional level.
Description:
Educate. Advocate. Collaborate.

NJIT Green is a student-led initiative to bring sustainability to NJIT. The team behind the movement is working to build relationships between students, faculty, and staff to promote green choices and practices on an institutional scale.

Here are some of our favorite events that we hold each year:

  1. Earth Day! A day when all organizations, labs, and departments on campus come together to celebrate sustainability.
  2. Our new Dual Chamber Composter. On the roof of the Campus Center, there is a new composter for all students, and faculty to use.
  3. Planting Events. Each semester we try to do at least one planting to increase the biodiversity on campus.
If you have any questions, ideas, or concerns, feel free to contact us at any time.

Our vision is to set NJIT as a leader in sustainability among other polytechnic universities and institutions around the country.

Summary: The mission of the Office of the Dean of Students is to support students both in and outside of the classroom through general advisement, advocacy, special programs and events, problem-solving, as well as implementing the Student Honor Code.
Description:
It is my honor to serve as the Dean of Students. The mission of the Office of the Dean of Students is to support students both in and outside of the classroom through general advisement, advocacy, special programs and events, problem-solving, as well as implementing the Code of Student Conduct and policies under the Title IX. The entire DOS team exists to create opportunities for student support and engagement. 

NJIT is uniquely positioned to attract a diverse intersection of the brightest minds to participate in solving the world’s most challenging problems. Our students have the capacity to innovate, to bring rich new perspectives to important endeavors. The Office of the Dean of Students has a crucial role to play in mobilizing the resources of the campus and broader community to help our students to achieve success and fulfill their vast potential.

Please contact us if you are having difficulties, if you have a great idea for improving student life on campus or if you are simply unsure about where to turn for help.  I encourage you to explore our webpage to learn more about the many services we provide.

name: Data Science Club
Summary: The overall purpose of the club is to educate the student body on various topics within Data Science. Members will learn about research and industry topics in Data Science, as well as engage in discussions, workshops, hackathons and more.
Description: The overall purpose of the club is to educate the student body on various topics within Data Science. Members will learn about research and industry topics in Data Science, as well as engage in discussions, workshops, hackathons and more. This club is aimed at the population of students studying Data Science by assisting their coursework through tutoring and the aforementioned activities. We are also appealing to students from outside of the major and even undergraduate students. All are welcome to attend the events to learn more about how Data Science, as it can help with their career and academic advancement. This has the added benefit of informing undergraduate students how “cool” a Masters in Data Science is, and keeps the talent within our university moving from undergraduate to graduate school. Although the Jersey City campus is dis-engaged from campus as a whole, we really want to connect with those students by supporting their transportation to our events on campus, or even going to their campus to connect as well. We are already coordinating with WiCS and ACM for future events, and hope to work with DeepCS and G-WiCS as well to build a positive cross-discipline relationship. In addition, we will have opportunities to connect with current industry professionals through projects, lectures and workshops. This opens up the opportunity for students to secure jobs as well.

name: Finance and Actuarial Society
Summary: Join the Finance and Actuarial Club at NJIT! Learn about the profession, gain valuable skills & study for SOA exams. Connect with industry leaders & learn Excel, SQL, SAS, VBA, Python & R. Stand out in the world of actuaries & have fun while doing it!
Description:
Hey there! Are you interested in the field of actuaries and looking for ways to give yourself an edge? Look no further than the renewed Finance and Actuarial Club at NJIT! This club is perfect for students who want to learn more about the profession and gain some valuable skills.

Not only can you study for the SOA Professional Exams with the help of the club's resources, but you'll also get to meet and connect with leaders in the field through events and guest speaker presentations. Plus, you'll get to learn and practice Excel, SQL, VBA, Python, and R. These skills are crucial for data analysis, modeling and automating the process of Actuary. These are the most important tools for the Actuary profession.

So if you're looking to break into the world of actuaries and stand out from the crowd, join the Finance and Actuarial Club at NJIT! It's a great way to get ahead and have some fun while you're at it.

Our organization will serve as a meeting ground for all Lebanese and non-Lebanese students that are interested in Lebanon and its culture. Some events that we may host include food spreads that will feature staples of Lebanese cuisine that all students on campus will be able to try; Traditional Lebanese nights featuring Lebanese music and dancing such as the "Dabke" and a tutorial on how to do it. Additional events include fundraising for NGOs and poor people in Lebanon to help the less privileged stuck in the crisis-ridden country.

name: National Society of Black Engineers
Summary: National Society of Black Engineers (NSBE) offers its members leadership training, professional development activities, mentoring, career placement services, community service opportunities and more.
Description:
The mission of the National Society of Black Engineers is "to increase the number of culturally responsible Black Engineers who excel academically, succeed professionally and positively impact the community."

The National Society of Black Engineers strives to accomplish the following objectives for our organization:

  • Stimulate and develop student interest in the various engineering disciplines
  • Strive to increase the number of minority students studying engineering at both the undergraduate and graduate levels 
  • Encourage members to seek advanced degrees in engineering or related fields and to obtain professional engineering registrations
  • Promote public awareness of engineering and the opportunities for Blacks and other minorities in that profession
  • Function as a representative body on issues and developments that affect the careers of Black Engineers  

Innovative project ideas are generated and implemented throughout the year on the chapter, regional and national levels. Some of NSBE's present activities include tutorial programs, group study sessions, high school/junior high outreach programs, technical seminars and workshops, a national communications network (NSBENET), two national magazines (NSBE Magazine and NSBE Bridge), an internal newsletter, a professional newsletter (Career Engineer, a supplement in NSBE Magazine), resume books, career fairs, awards, banquets and an annual national convention.

We host many events that give students the opportunity to make connections with companies and professionals.

name: Transect
Summary: HCAD's student-produced architectural journal
Description:
Transect is the student-produced architectural journal of NJIT’s Hillier College of Architecture and Design. The publication seeks to contribute to and situate the school’s work within broader stands of contemporary architectural discourse by publishing student projects and essays as well as original essays by faculty, scholars, and practitioners. Transect is published once a year, in physical and digital form.

Originally begun in 2019 as a catalog of exemplary student work to serve as a resource for students, Transect has grown in scope to provide critical commentary on and explorations of the nature and potentials of architecture and its pedagogy while arguing for its continued relevance. The publication takes its name from the title of the school’s Spring 2019 lecture series and embodies a way of seeing that encourages interdisciplinarity, mixed methods of presentation, and engagement across the wide and varied landscape of architectural discourse, past and present.

Transect also regularly publishes student-produced architectural writing in a tabloid called Iteration that is published physically and digitally on Substack. Previous topics have included inclusionary spaces, school/life balance in architecture school, and architectural criticism of NJIT’s Newark campus.

Join our Discord to stay up to date with us!

name: Filipinos In Newark Engaging in Sociocultural Traditions
Summary: The purpose of the Filipinos in Newark Engaging Socio-Cultural Traditions of NJIT shall be to benefit the NJIT community by spreading knowledge and culture of the Philippines through food, music, history, dance, and language.
Description:
We are the Filipinos In Newark Engaging In Sociocultural Traditions, a.k.a. FINEST. Our goal is to spread the knowledge of the Filipino culture through a variety of events that range from food, to music, history, dance, and language. Our club is open to everyone who wants to learn more about the Filipino culture and want to bond with other fellow Filipino or Filipino-American students in NJIT.

 

Examples of events we hold:

- Reign or Shine: Our annual dancing event held once a year that brings the dancing community together from across the Tri-state area and either showcases or competes at our event to bring to the NJIT community an amazing show filled with talent.

- Ate, Kuya, Bunso Program (AKB): Want to bond within our FINEST community? Our Ate Kuya Bunso program, a.k.a. our AKB program, aims to partner people with a "lineage" and connects them with fellow peers within FINEST to build a closer bond. These lineages also give opportunity to connect with Alumni to give them opportunities on how they can take advantage of their future careers.

- Cooking Nights: We also hold cooking events every year for our members to get a hands-on experience on how to cook a variety of Filipino dishes, ranging from kare kare, sinigang, pancit canton, etc.

 

External events:

FINEST is also a member of Filipino Intercollegiate Networking Dialogue, Incorporated (FIND Inc.), a non-profit organization aimed to promote unity and connection with Filipino students in universities across the eastern seaboard. Composed of nine "districts", we are currently associated with the 3rd district, also known as District Three (D3), which is composed of 29 different colleges from North Jersey, Long Island, and Metro NYC. Events that we participate in include Mr./Ms. Philippines (pageant), Wanna Canta (singing competition), Sportsfest (volleyball and basketball competition), etc.

 

Feel free to join our discord!

Want to stay updated on news in FINEST? Join our mailing list!

Follow our Instagram!

Our office is located in the Campus Center Basement, in office B15. Feel free to stop by and visit!

Summary: The Swim Club is an organization that will provide an environment in which individuals can either learn or improve their ability to swim at the pool in the WEC.
Description:
Welcome to The Swim Club at NJIT!

 

Our organization is dedicated to fostering a welcoming and inclusive environment within the NJIT community, where individuals can learn or enhance their swimming abilities while prioritizing both physical and mental well-being.

 

Whether you're a beginner dipping your toes into the water for the first time or an experienced swimmer looking to refine your technique, The Swim Club is here for you. We offer guidance and support to swimmers at all levels, from those learning the basics to those seeking to improve their health and fitness.

 

But we're more than just a swim club, we're a community. Our goal is to create a space where students can escape the stresses of school, connect with others, and enjoy the benefits of swimming in a judgment-free zone. Whether you're looking to conquer a fear of water, challenge yourself, or simply have a good time, you'll find a home with us. Join us for pool sessions, social events, and more!

 

Connect with us to keep up-to-date with our events:

NOTE: Please check you spam folder if you are already a member and not receiving emails from us!

name: Spikeball Club
Summary: An arising sport, called Spikeball, will be played, spreading awareness of this awesome sport on campus!
Description:
Spikeball is a sport consisting of a round net played among four players. A team, comprising of 2 players, would spike the ball to the opposing team. Similar to volleyball, the opposing team needs to hit, or spike, the ball back to the team that they are playing against. Spikeball is normally played as 2v2. Each team needs to work together to spike the ball at the net while making it harder for the other team to spike the ball back. Through this club, members will not only learn how to play Spikeball but also enhance their communicational skills and meet new people on campus! Whether it is your first time playing or not, everyone is encouraged to join!

We’re building footbridges to provide pathways to opportunities. We’re installing solar panels to bring light where it is dark. We’re digging for water so hope can spring from the ground. Each project builds the foundation for a community to thrive for years to come.

EWB-USA builds a better world through engineering projects that empower communities to meet their basic human needs and equip leaders to solve the world’s most pressing challenges.

EWB-USA’s vision is a world in which every community has the capacity to sustainably meet their basic human needs.

name: Students for Hunger Relief
Summary: Hunger Relief organization focused on holding on-campus food-packing events to alleviate malnutrition in the broader Newark community
Description:
We organize large-scale, on-campus initiatives to address hunger in Newark and connect NJIT students to the surrounding community. Our initiatives involve working with external charitable organizations to acquire food and then holding on-campus packing events where volunteers prepare hundreds of meals. The meals from past initiatives have included rice, chicken, beef chili, chicken curry, and salad, which we acquired from 501(c)(3) accredited organizations. Once all the food is packed, SFHR leads distribution efforts at various locations in Newark like Penn Station, Lincoln Park, Covenant House, and other shelters. Events are held monthly in Campus Center followed by a regular general body meeting.

NJIT students have been instrumental in expanding the scope of hunger relief in the city of Newark in an informal capacity over the past year. What started out as a small team of four students has grown into a group of more than sixty committed members consistently and successfully delivering hundreds of meals on a monthly basis. Our group of volunteers is continuing to expand, and we encourage you to get involved as well!

The Art Club is a student organization dedicated to providing students with supplies and activities that allow them to explore their creative (visual) passions within a technical school. We're always interested in working with new mediums and connecting with the student body, and helping artists grow.

Feel free to join our Discord and mailing list, and welcome to the club!

Join our Discord

name: Ronald E. McNair Postbaccalaureate Achievement Program
Summary: The Ronald E. McNair Post-baccalaureate Achievement program, awards grants to​ institutions of higher education for projects designed to provide underrepresented students with effective preparation for doctoral study.
Description: The New Jersey Institute of Technology (NJIT) Ronald E. McNair Post-baccalaureate Achievement program is a comprehensive one. It is designed to help low-income and first-generation or underrepresented students majoring in Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) disciplines to complete their bachelor's degree, and to enroll in post-baccalaureate degree programs, with the goal of obtaining doctoral degrees.

name: Learning Communities
Summary:
Modeling the building blocks of success!

Your Learning Community will play a critical role in helping you get acclimated to university life and on track for a successful first year! Learn Together, Connect for Life!
Description:
Modeling the building blocks of success!

 

As students transition to university life, their experience is more positive and successful if they get the support they need.

 

Learning Communities allow students to:

  • Network with students and professors

  • Collaborate with peers on projects in and outside of class

  • Develop an understanding of how their learning experiences relate to their career goals

  • Become involved in active learning experiences, including cooperative learning, service learning, and research projects

  • Exposure to academic and career development resources

  • Opportunities to showcase exceptional student work

 

Your Learning Community will play a critical role in helping you get acclimated to university life and on track for a successful first year!

name: Makerspace
Summary: The NJIT Makerspace is a rapid prototyping and collaboration facility where engineers, architects, designers, and scientists can create and test ideas, put theory into practice, and turn ideas into reality.
Description:
This 21st-century prototyping, manufacturing, and collaborative space allows students, faculty, and industry partners, to build physical systems in a functional and inspirational environment.

"If you can dream it, you can make it at NJIT"

The 10,000 square-foot Makerspace is the largest of its kind in New Jersey and houses the industrial-grade tools and technologies that today’s STEM students must master in order to become tomorrow’s innovators and leaders. It provides them a venue where they can test ideas, visualize, create prototypes, and apply complex technologies, machines, and materials used in state-of-the-art manufacturing. Through this process all participants gain real-world experience across an array of industries. Among other functions, the Makerspace offers equipment and devices for 3D printing, additive manufacturing, material cutting and shaping, metrology, visualization, computing, emulation, and simulation.

name: Peer Wellness Coaching
Summary: Peer Wellness Coaching is an opportunity for undergraduate students to maximize their well-being!
Description: Specially trained student coaches are available to meet individually and in groups to discuss health and wellness goals and empower their peers to achieve them. This program is funded in part by the Healthcare Foundation of New Jersey and student coaches are supervised by NJIT’s Center for Counseling and Psychological Services and Campus Health Services. (Coaching is NOT professional counseling, health services, or advising; so if you need or want these services, then a coach can connect you to them.)

name: American Society of Mechanical Engineers
Summary: The American Society of Mechanical Engineers (ASME) is an American professional association that promotes the art, science, and practice of multidisciplinary engineering and allied sciences around the globe.
Description: The American Society of Mechanical Engineers (ASME) is an American professional association that, in its own words, "promotes the art, science, and practice of multidisciplinary engineering and allied sciences around the globe" via "continuing education, training and professional development, codes and standards, research, conferences and publications, government relations, and other forms of outreach." ASME is thus an engineering society, a standards organization, a research and development organization, an advocacy organization, a provider of training and education, and a nonprofit organization. Founded as an engineering society focused on mechanical engineering in North America, ASME is today multidisciplinary and global.

name: Nepali Student Association
Summary: Nepali Student Association
Description:
Mission Statement: The Nepali Student Association (NEPSA) at NJIT is dedicated to fostering a supportive and inclusive community for students of Nepali heritage and anyone interested in Nepalese culture. Our mission is to celebrate our rich cultural heritage, promote cultural awareness, and provide a platform for networking, academic support, and personal growth.

What We Do:

  • Cultural Events: We organize various cultural events throughout the year, including traditional festivals like Dashain, Tihar, and Holi. These events are a vibrant showcase of Nepali music, dance, food, and traditions.
  • Social Gatherings
  • Community Service
  • Networking Opportunities
  • Support System: We offer a strong support system for new students, helping them acclimate to university life and navigate academic and personal challenges.

Join Us: Whether you are of Nepali descent or simply interested in learning more about Nepalese culture, the Nepali Student Association at NJIT welcomes you. Join us to celebrate our heritage, make new friends, and enrich your university experience.

 

Discord link: https://discord.gg/GGkXahR6

name: Institute of Industrial and Systems Engineers
Summary: Professional Organization for Industrial Engineering Majors

name: Industrial Designers Society of America
Summary: The Industrial Design Society of America offers workshops, lectures, career development, portfolio building, field trips, and design competitions to all design students. Our organization seeks to provide all of our members with a supportive network.
Description:
"If architects design the house, then industrial designers design everything inside."

Industrial design surrounds the world around us, every product you encounter and interact with is the result of a rigorous design process. A combination of art, design, engineering, and critical problem solving, Industrial Design lies at the crossroads of dozens of other fields. 

IDSA is the only professional society of Industrial Designers in the United States. This organization works to advance the practice of Industrial Design through education, information, community, and advocacy.

NJIT's chapter has been around for over 10 years and is growing fast to encompass all that this field has to offer. Offering workshops, lectures, career development, portfolio building, field trips, and design competitions to all design students, our organization seeks to bridge the gap between art and engineering.

name: Chinese Students and Scholars Association (CSSA)
Summary: Chinese Students and Scholars Association (CSSA) for graduate students.

name: Highlander Integrity Council
Summary: TBD
Description: TBD

name: Alpha Phi Alpha Fraternity Inc.
Summary: Alpha Phi Alpha Fraternity

name: Alpha Rho Chapter of Alpha Sigma Phi Fraternity
Summary: A group of Gentlemen and Scholars who seek to Better the Man through the creation and perpetuation of brotherhood founded upon the values of character: Silence, Charity, Purity, Honor, and Patriotism.
Description:
Founded nationally in 1845 and locally in 1921, Alpha Sigma Phi seeks to Better the Man through our five values of character: Silence, Charity, Purity, Honor, and Patriotism. A brotherhood that sticks together and rises much like the Phoenix of legend.

Causa Latet Vis Est Notissima. The Cause is Hidden, the Results Well Known.

name: Alpha Kappa Psi
Summary: Alpha Kappa Psi is a Professional Co-ed Business Fraternity founded in 1904 with the purpose of developing its members into principled business leaders.
Description: Alpha Kappa Psi is a Professional Co-ed Business Fraternity founded in 1904 with the purpose of developing its members into principled business leaders. Originally founded by 4 men at New York University, the professional organization now has over 298,000 initiated members at 219 universities in 4 countries. Alpha Kappa Psi has grown to be the oldest and largest business fraternity in the world! With an extensive network of alumni, members are able to land opportunities at some of the most profitable companies in the world. As one of the best professional co-ed business fraternities, we are truly preparing our brothers for a life of success.

name: Lambda Tau Omega Sorority Incorporated
Summary: Lambda Tau Omega Sorority Inc. is a non-profit Greek letter organization that was founded on October 9th, 1988 at Montclair State University. Our mascot is the Enchanting Mermaid and our motto is womyn empowerment.  We are the Trilogy Gamma Chapter.

name: Alpha Rho Chi
Summary: Alpha Rho Chi is a co-ed professional fraternity for architecture and the allied arts.

name: Tau Delta Phi
Summary: Tau Delta Phi aims to culture men of quality regardless of their race, religion, or identity.
Description: Tau Delta Phi is one of the oldest chapters at NJIT founded in 1947 at the then Newark College of Engineering. From its inception, Tau Delta Phi has demonstrated its progressive place within the fraternal movement. Its exceptional direction has led Tau Delta Phi to be a fraternity of firsts: the first to end fraternal segregation, the first modest sized national fraternity to remove pledging and operate under a developmental training model for all members, and one of the first organizations to be accepting of men based solely on the content of their character, not the color of their skin, the way they choose to worship or not worship God, the country their family comes from, or even who they choose to fall in love with.

name: Psi Upsilon
Summary: Psi Upsilon is a social fraternity, one of the oldest in the United States. Our deep rooted brotherhood offers great alumni connections, leadership and employment, and community service opportunities. We are the Alpha Omicron chapter.
Description: Psi Upsilon is a social fraternity, one of the oldest in the United States founded in 1833. Our deep rooted brotherhood offers great alumni connections, as well as leadership, employment, and community service opportunities. We are the Alpha Omicron chapter.

name: NJIT Community Chorus
Summary: The NJIT Community Chorus seeks to teach its members about music theory and explore a diverse range of music genres in performances so that we can bring different styles to the campus.
Description: The NJIT Community Chorus is a vocal instrumental ensemble at NJIT. We sing songs from different genres, from Gregorian chants to 21st century atonal music. We want to explore different styles of harmony, tonality and expression that composers from across time have tried to evoke in their music. In addition to classical music, we will sing folk music from around the world, jazz and gospel. Join our choir family in singing and lend your voice to the beautiful harmonies!

name: YWCC Mentoring Program
Summary: An extracurricular activity welcome to all students interested in further developing academically and professionally in the field of computing.
Description:
The YWCC Mentoring Program is an extracurricular activity welcome to all students interested in further developing academically and professionally in computing.

As a student-run program, mentors will be working together to create dynamic and interactive workshops, panels, and discussion sessions relating to topics in career development, collaborative projects, personal branding, networking, and opportunities inside and outside of NJIT.

We encourage and welcome students who are not mentors or mentees to attend our general body meetings and progress further in the realm of computing. Altogether, every student will gain the skills necessary to be leaders, innovators, and accomplish their goals by having a focus on professional development, academic success and mentoring relationships. 

 

Mentors

We are looking for mentors who aren't experts, but have a passion for computing, learning, contributing to YWCC, and are open-minded. Peer mentors will be working together to create dynamic and interactive workshops, panels, and discussion sessions relating to topics in career development, academics, projects, personal branding, networking, and opportunities inside and outside of NJIT. If you are interested in working in a collaborative environment with other tech enthusiasts, join now :)

 

Mentees:

  • Unsure of your major?
  • How to get started in the professional industry?
  • Need course assistance?

 

Our purpose is to assist students to continue their growth by improving on their current skills and building new ones in the field of computing. Students attending the Ying Wu College of Computing voluntarily apply to become mentors. Many of them have been in your footsteps and it's with their enthusiasm they share their experiences in the professional industry, college life, and obstacles they have gone through to excel in the computing realm. This is a flexible program to meet your needs and help you get a seat at the table.

name: Oak Hall
Summary: Oak Hall is a coed apartment facility that houses 180 full-time sophomore, junior, senior and graduate students in two person rooms and three, four-person apartments.
Description: Oak Hall is a coed apartment facility that houses 180 full-time sophomore, junior, senior and graduate students in two person rooms and three, four-person apartments. Each room/apartment is furnished with a bed, dresser, wardrobe closet, desk, chair and lamp for each student. The rooms have stove tops, refrigerators, kitchen tables and chairs; the three and four person apartments also have ovens. The eighth floor is designated for graduate students. Two-person apartments end in room numbers 02, 04, 05, 06 and 07; three-person apartments end in 00, 01 and four-person apartments end in 08 and 09.

name: Food Pantry
Summary: The NJIT Food Pantry aims to help students with food insecurity, promote nutrition, and support student success through providing pantry staples to users, hosting food drives within the community, and educating students on assistance programs.
Description:
The NJIT Food Pantry aims to help students with food insecurity, promote nutrition, and support student success through providing pantry staples to users, hosting food drives within the community, and educating students on assistance programs.  

Food Pantry appointments can be made for the first time by emailing foodpantry@njit.edu.

Students will need to bring their Student ID with them and may visit the pantry once per week. Hours during break periods (winter/spring/summer) may vary and are appointment only.

name: PhD Club
Summary: PhD Club
Description: PhD Club is a dynamic hub dedicated to guiding doctoral students through every facet of their PhD. Our mission encompasses multifaceted support, spanning various stages of the program. By organizing academic and professional exposure opportunities, we empower members to expand their horizons. A collaborative platform ignites knowledge exchange and celebrates academic triumphs. Additionally, we serve as a resource for undergraduates and master's students aspiring to pursue a doctoral degree, offering insights, advice, and a roadmap to success in academia. Join us to thrive in a nurturing community that amplifies growth and knowledge.

name: Knit N' Crochet Club
Summary: In this organization, we come together to learn how to knit and crochet. We create projects such as blankets, hats, and scarves and donate these handmade garments to charities in Newark like the soup kitchen and Apostles Homeless shelter.
Description:
In this organization, we come together to learn how to knit and crochet. We create projects such as blankets, hats and scarves and donate these handmade garments to charities in Newark like the soup kitchen and Apostles Homeless shelter. We also work on various service projects throughout the semester such a toiletry drives and food drives to give back to the NJIT and Newark community.

 

Join our Discord! https://discord.com/invite/DGvg2rjZuJ

name: Medical Humanities Club
Summary: The Medical Humanities Club's main goal is to educate our members to stand up against injustices in the medical field and help procure the best possible outcomes as future patients and/or medical providers.
Description: The purpose of the medical humanities club is to facilitate constructive dialogue regarding bioethics and medical humanities. We are dedicated to addressing common injustices in healthcare through meetings with expert guest speakers, volunteer opportunities, and drafting legislative proposals.

name: American Water Works Association Student Chapter
Summary: AWWA is dedicated to helping students build connections in the water industry. Water plant tours, volunteer park/stream clean ups and professional events are some opportunities from which students can learn more about water and taking care of our planet.
Description: AWWA Student Chapter at NJIT works closely with the civil engineering department and hopes to bring students from other majors. Our members have interest in the water industry including water supply, distribution, and quality. Through our events, members learn more about water as we emphasize on our dedication to take care of our environment. Our members volunteer at nearby parks or streams, visit water and wastewater treatment plants which helps them broaden their knowledge and experiences. Our professional events also help our members build connections and find job opportunities.

name: Book Club
Summary: We aim to promote the joy of reading and create a space for individuals to delve into various genres, authors, and literary works. We believe in the power of books to inspire, educate, entertain, and be a form of escapism in someone's everyday life.
Description: Join the discord:https://discord.gg/T358H3f65p

name: CyWood Hall Council
Summary: The governing body for the residents of Cypress and Redwood Hall
Description: The governing body for the residents of Cypress and Redwood Hall

name: Veteran Student Organization
Summary: The Veteran Students Organization is dedicated to providing support for NJIT's student veterans and military affiliated students.
Description: The Veteran Students Organization (VSO) at NJIT is a chapter of Student Veterans of America (SVA) which is the premier organization leading service, research, programs, and advocacy for veterans in higher education.  Our mission at NJIT is to bridge the gap between military-connected students and civilian life.

name: United Mission for Relief & Development
Summary: The purpose of this organization is to implement targeted, cost-effective relief and development programs that improve lives.
Description: The purpose of this organization is to implement targeted, cost-effective relief, development programs that improve lives and to provide students an outlet for giving, community service, and a global impact on poverty. UMR believes that everyone across the world is entitled to clean water, health and dental care, and to have access to basic social services no matter their race or religion. The UMR NJIT will serve local communities and support UMR’s international initiatives through advocacy, training and fundraising.

name: Business Masterminds
Summary: The purpose of the Business Masterminds Club is to benefit and support the NJIT undergraduate and graduate student community by introducing, exposing, and educating them on practical skills applied to and in the different aspects of business.
Description:
Business Masterminds is here to benefit and support the NJIT undergraduate and graduate student community by introducing, exposing, and educating them on practical skills applied to and in the different aspects of business across various sectors and disciplines. 

 

 

Meetings will include general discussion meetings, workshops and professional panel speaking/networking events with guest speakers, competitions, and more! We learn all about the technical business terms and concepts in our classes, but we want our members to apply what they learn and in order to do that we plan to have workshops, field trips, and more to help apply what is learned!

 

 

Don't forget to follow us on Instagram and participate in our giveaways this semester to get gift cards and Business Masterminds merch!!

name: Turkish Student Association
Summary: Turkish Student Association
Description:
Welcome to our Turkish Student Association at NJIT! Whether you’re a Turkish student, an alum, or simply curious about Turkish culture, you’ve found your home away from home. Our vibrant community is dedicated to celebrating and sharing the richness of Turkish heritage while fostering lasting friendships and connections.

At TSA, we believe in creating a warm and welcoming environment where everyone feels valued and included. 

Aside from Highlander Hub, our Instagram account is your go-to source for staying updated on upcoming events, so fo ahead and give us a follow @njit_tsa. 

Join us in embracing Turkish culture, forging lifelong connections, and making memories that will last a lifetime. We can’t wait to meet you and welcome you into the TSA family! Sevgiler, TSA Ailesi 🇹🇷💙

name: First Fellows
Summary: First Fellows is an organization with the purpose of helping incoming and undergraduate first-generation college students transitioning through their undergraduate years at New Jersey Institute of Technology.
Description: The purpose of this organization is to provide guidance to incoming and undergraduate students that identify or are recognized as first generation. Providing the appropriate materials and resources for the incoming and undergraduate first-generation students will make their transition into college easier. For incoming and undergraduate students, this organization will provide constant and consistent guidance, and eventually mentorship, to aid them for any college related needs.

name: Pi Kappa Phi
Summary: Pi Kappa Phi
Description: Welcome to Phi Kappa Phi Fraternity, where academic excellence and brotherhood converge. Since our establishment in 1948, we have been committed to fostering a community of driven individuals who strive for scholarly achievement, leadership, and service. Through our diverse range of events, mentorship programs, and philanthropic initiatives, we empower our members to excel both academically and personally, forming bonds that last a lifetime. Join us in our pursuit of knowledge, camaraderie, and making a positive impact on the world. Together, we embody the spirit of Phi Kappa Phi - a beacon of intellectual curiosity and lifelong learning.

name: Tau Kappa Epsilon
Summary: Tau Kappa Epsilon is a social fraternity that promotes love, charity, and esteem.
Description:
Tau Kappa Epsilon

Tau Kappa Epsilon is a men’s social fraternity with hundreds of prominent alumni and was established January 10, 1899, at Illinois Wesleyan University. With more than 250 active chapters and colonies in the United States and Canada, Tau Kappa Epsilon’s membership is as diverse and unique as the collegiate and universities in which we reside. There isn’t a proper blanket statement that is able to capture the essence of what a member of Tau Kappa Epsilon, or rather a “Teke” is—that’s up to you to decide.

Men like Ronald Reagan, Steve Forbes, Danny Thomas, Conrad Hilton, and Charles R. Walgreen actively sought to better themselves, and in return, better the Fraternity. 


Have you heard about our Commuter Rush Education Program?

At Tau Kappa Epsilon we believe that regardless of your residency status whether it's on-campus or as a commuter, that it shouldn't stop you from being able to join our fraternity and becoming part of our brotherhood. Be sure to follow our Instagram page @njittke for updates about our Rushing process and events we'll be hosting at NJIT so that you can meet the brothers!

name: Professional Women in Construction NJ Student Chapter
Summary: Professional Women in Construction Student Chapter
Description: Professional Women in Construction Student Chapter aims to assist women studying/working in the architecture, construction, and engineering industries. We want to create a community that promotes gender diversity in traditionally male-dominated fields. Our organization offers personal/professional mentorship, opportunities for field practices(shadow days), so students get a feeling of what the work environment feels like in their field of interest, and events like Site Tours, Lunch and Learn, and Networking Days.

name: Highlander Pep Band
Summary: The highlander pep band is a student-run group of musicians founded on the premise of bringing music to athletic events on campus.
Description:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScq_UMsRipb2ZmTFXtlf0jlKJs9OPbgS4n77GbnabbYXJxSmw/viewform?gxids=7628

 

Instrumentation includes but is not limited to; flutes, clarinets, alto saxophones, baritone saxophone, trumpets, trombones, tuba, guitar, snare drums and bass drum. The pep band plays traditional stand tunes to pop music to jazz. The pep band plays at men's and women's basketball games, highlander thon and homecoming events. As the pep band grows and evolves, we'd love to play at other school events such as open houses, new student orientation and accepted students day.

name: Laurel Hall
Summary: Laurel Hall is a coed facility that houses 582 sophomore, junior, senior and graduate students in two-room suites. Suites consist of two double rooms, one double room with a single room, or two double rooms with a single
Description: Laurel Hall is a coed facility that houses 582 sophomore, junior, senior and graduate students in two-room suites. Suites consist of two double rooms, one double room with a single room, or two double rooms with a single. Single rooms are reserved for returning upper class students. Suites are furnished with a bed, dresser, desk, chair and lamp for each student. Each suite has a shared bathroom. Common lounges and kitchenette facilities are located on the first floor. The approximate double room measurements are 12’ x 16” (bedroom) and 8’ x 12” (foyer).

name: Saavan
Summary: NJIT's first South-Asian a cappella group.

name: Model United Nations Club
Summary: The Model United Nations club encourages students to engage in the ever-changing field of international relations and polish their public speaking skills by simulating the United Nations.
Description: The purpose of the Model United Nations Club shall be to benefit the NJIT community by engaging the student body in international relations through public speaking and improve their public speaking skills while participating in Model United Nations tournaments both nationally and internationally. We believe that students can broaden their horizons by learning about other cultures and countries.

name: NJIT Dance Team
Summary: The NJIT Dance Team is the official dance team of the university's athletic department. With each performance, the NJIT Dance Team hopes to spread the values of spirit, tradition, and culture throughout the NJIT community.
Description: The NJIT Dance Team is the official dance team of the university's athletic department. They serve as Ambassadors for NJIT and represent the university at various athletic and community events around campus. Coming from diverse performance and athletic backgrounds, they have created a diverse group of dancers with varying strengths. The NJIT Dance Team can be found at every home men’s and women’s basketball game, bringing spirit to the crowd with their energetic hip-hop routines. In addition, the team embraces weekly performances during their season by also appearing at numerous philanthropic events and showcases. With each performance, the NJIT Dance Team hopes to spread the values of spirit, tradition, and culture throughout the NJIT community.

name: First Year Students - for Student Senate
Summary: First Year students

name: Hispanic and Latinx Leadership Council
Summary: New Jersey Institute of Technology has launched the Hispanic and Latinx Leadership Council (HLLC) to propel its mission of enrolling more Hispanic and Latinx students and achieve its goal of becoming a Hispanic-serving institution.
Description: The 11-person council — which features leaders in business and community advocacy, including seven alumni — will advise, counsel and support NJIT’s drive to increase its percentage of Hispanic and Latinx undergraduates from 20% to 25% by 2025 and thereby qualify to earn the federal designation of being Hispanic-serving. In addition, the HLLC will seek to deepen relationships with Hispanic and Latinx alumni, businesses and organizations.

name: Phi Eta Sigma - National First Year Honor Society
Summary: To encourage and reward high scholastic achievement among members of the first year cohort.
Description:
First-year students who are in good academic and disciplinary standing, have a 3.5 GPA or higher, and are enrolled full time are eligible (reach out to PhiEtaSigma@njit.edu if you have questions). 

 

Inducted members benefit from access to scholarships (over $300,000 awarded annually across the nation!), a national and local network of leaders and peers, personal and professional development and of course national recognition of academic excellence!

name: Entrepreneur Society
Summary: We provide students interested in entrepreneurship with the information and tools required to start their own business. From networking to pitch practice to hands-on trips. Students will be given the support and resources needed.

name: Polish Student Association
Summary: The Polish Student Association (PSA) is committed to sharing Polish values, customs, and traditions with the NJIT community.
Description:
The Polish Student Association (PSA) is committed to sharing Polish values, customs, and traditions with the NJIT community.  

       We represent the university at cultural events, most notably the Pulaski Parade in New York City, the largest Polish parade on the East Coast, where we proudly walk down 5th Avenue, holding up our club banner and waving our flags for those watching on the sides.  

    Above all, we seek to build a dedicated and involved community through our social events and cultural celebrations, especially Wigilia and Wielkanoc, where we all gather around to celebrate our shared heritage and reflect upon the progress we have made as a club.

    To learn more about what we do, reach out to us by email (polish@njit.edu), our GroupMe (link below), or our Instagram page (@njitpsa). We hope to see you at our upcoming events!

Our default contact is through the polish@njit.edu email and the advisor for our organization is Amber Danku. 

GroupMe: https://web.groupme.com/join_group/44599895/yIbtbc

name: Advocates for Sexual Health Awareness
Summary: Advocates for Sexual Health Awareness is a student group dedicated to providing education and outreach to the NJIT community about healthy relationships, sexual health, consent, empowerment and campus resources.
Description:
Advocates for Sexual Health Awareness is a student organization dedicated to providing education and outreach to the NJIT community about healthy relationships, sexual health, consent, empowerment and campus resources.

 

As the first official student organization recongized under Title IX, ASHA is dedicated to reducing sexual violence and encouraging safe relationships on campus. We want to empower students with the power we have as students ourselves. Our goals are to make campus a safer place by reducing discrimination based on race, gender, sexual orientation and gender. We promote healthy, safe sex and relationships, and always enforce the use of consent. We hope to create a safer enviorment for students and faculty each day.

name: Women's Residential Initiative at NJIT
Summary: The Women's Residential Initiative at NJIT's (W.I.N.) mission is to develop holistic programming to bring residential women collectively together to cultivate life skills that will help them thrive and flourish personally and professionally.
Description: The Women's Residential Initiative at NJIT's (W.I.N.) mission is to develop holistic programming to bring women collectively together to cultivate life skills that will help them thrive and flourish personally and professionally during and after college. Ultimately to provide opportunities for residents to develop a support network and establish a tight-knit community on NJIT campus

name: Bangladeshi Students' Association
Summary: The Bangladeshi Students' Association is an organization that serves the NJIT community by upholding the values of diversity, compassion, and friendship. We proudly celebrate the Bangladeshi heritage, cultures, and traditions.
Description:
Founded in Fall 2014, and approved by NJIT student Senate in Spring 2015, Bangladeshi Students' Association of NJIT (BSA) is a club comprised of NJIT undergraduate students as officers and is open to all members affiliated with NJIT.

The main purpose of our club is to spread Bangladeshi culture and display our individuality to the NJIT community while participating in the chant of diversity. Through a variety of events, we embody our culture and traditions and foster unity among students regardless of their ethnic backgrounds. 


If you have any questions, please email us at bsa+managers@njit.edu !

name: College of Science and Liberal Arts - Dean's Office
Summary: The College of Science and Liberal Arts was formed in 1982.  It was originally known as the Third College because it had been preceded by NJIT’s Newark College of Engineering and the New Jersey School of Architecture.
Description: The College of Science & Liberal Arts was founded in 1982. It was originally known as the Third College, as it had been preceded by NJIT’s Newark College of Engineering and the New Jersey School of Architecture. In 1986, as a result of a more distinctly defined mission and direction, the name of the college was officially changed to the College of Science and Liberal Arts (CSLA). Growing steadily ever since, CSLA has spawned three of NJIT’s six schools and colleges: the School of Industrial Management (now the Martin Tuchman School of Management)was spun out of CSLA’s Department of Organizational and Social Sciences in 1987, the Albert Dorman Honors College (founded in 1995), which evolved out of the Honors Program that was established within CSLA in 1985, and the College of Computing Sciences (now Ying Wu College of Computing), which evolved from CSLA’s Department of Computer and Information Science in 2001.

name: University Admissions Student Ambassadors
Summary: Are you bursting with Highlander pride? Do you love sharing your NJIT story with others? Join our team and connect with prospective students, friends, and family members to help them learn all about NJIT.
Description: We are a group of undergraduate students who help volunteer and work different events on campus and virtually where we share our experiences and become student leaders on campus.

name: Newark College of Engineering
Summary: The Newark College of Engineering at New Jersey Institute of Technology.
Description: The college has been providing quality engineering education since 1919. An estimated one in four professional engineers in the State of New Jersey are NCE alumni. Furthermore, the more than 40,000 living NCE alumni work in virtually every region of the whole world, often as CEOs or presidents of large engineering companies. NCE alumni have been pioneers and leaders in such fields as aerospace, television, telecommunications, plastics, electronics and environmental engineering.

name: Office of Inclusive Excellence (IE)
Summary: Welcome to the NJIT Office of Inclusive Excellence (IE) page!
Description: Our mission is to create an inclusive campus community by celebrating diversity, centering equity, and practicing inclusion in hopes of creating a culture of belonging.

name: Philosophy Club
Summary: Philosophy Club

name: Association for Computing Machinery
Summary: The NJIT chapter of ACM offers free tutoring for CS, IT, and IS classes, contains SIGs (special interest groups) dedicated to teaching various computer science topics, and works on various computer science-related projects.
Description:
What is ACM you might ask? ACM stands for the Association for Computing Machinery, and it is the world's largest educational computer science organization. ACM is divided up into many student chapters, and this one just happens to be located at, you guessed it, NJIT! If you're a student studying CS, IT, IS, or any other computer-related field, chances are that you'll find joining ACM to be useful. Whether you join for tutoring, use of ACM's vast array of online resources, or just to connect with fellow programmers, ACM is a great organization to be a part of.

More specifically, the NJIT chapter of ACM offers free tutoring for CS, IT, and IS classes, contains SIGs (special interest groups) dedicated to teaching various computer science topics, works on various computer science-related projects, and works closely with the NJIT Ying Wu College of Computing to host a number events including HackNJIT, NJIT's own 24-hour hackathon. The NJIT chapter of ACM also occasionally takes trips to the headquarters of various companies to give students the opporunity to get an inside-look into real-world job environments. More information regarding our tutoring services, SIGs, projects, HackNJIT, and more is available through clicking the tabs above.

While ACM is a professional organization, we also pride ourselves in trying to make our office a fun, safe, and friendly work environment. After quiet hours end at 6 PM, the office becomes a place where people can play video games, watch movies, and relax after a hard day of work. We urge all students to join us for both our professional services, and to simply unwind after a long day of classes. Join the NJIT ACM Discord (https://discord.gg/XR6qPze) to stay up-to-date on everything ACM!

name: Graduate Society of Women Engineers
Summary: The graduate section of Society of Women Engineers (SWE) at NJIT aims to support the professional and personal development of the female graduate students (either M.S. or Ph.D. candidates) at NJIT.
Description:
The graduate section of Society of Women Engineers (SWE) at NJIT aims to support the professional and personal development of the female graduate students (either M.S. or Ph.D. candidates) at NJIT. The issues that SWE intends to address include work-life balance for women, scholarship and funding opportunities, finding an academic or industry path based on mentoring programs and collaborations with university as well as industry representatives, etc. This section also focuses on facilitating mentoring the transition of undergraduate students towards graduate school. For this goal, the graduate section of SWE works closely with the undergraduate section at NJIT.

The New Jersey Institute of Technology (NJIT) SWE collegiate section is a dynamic organization, dedicated to creating a bridge between students and professional opportunities. Our focus is to honor SWE's vision in advancing young women in their career as engineers and leaders by expanding the image of engineering profession, and demonstrating the value of diversity in the work place. NJIT's section of SWE is a great opportunity for students to be more involved on campus, to gain professional connections and skills, to network, and much more!

The Society of Women Engineers (SWE), founded in 1950, is a not-for-profit educational and service organization. SWE is the driving force that establishes engineering as a highly desirable career aspiration for women. SWE empowers women to succeed and advance in those aspirations and be recognized for their life-changing contributions and achievements as engineers and leaders.

Clayton 81' Learning Center.  If you have any questions or comments, please contact us at tlc@njit.edu.

Summary: Panhellenic is the governing council for all NPC and local sororities at NJIT. We aim to grow the sorority community, host meaningful and fun events for initiated members, and raise money to help remove educational barriers for girls facing poverty.
Description: The NJIT Panhellenic Council is an extension of the National Panhellenic Conference (NPC) which is comprised of 26 national/international sororities. Initiated members from regular NPC sororities (ΑΣΤ+ΔɸΕ) and associate sororities (ΣΨΚ) serve as E-Board members and delegates to create a better sorority experience at NJIT from recruitment to graduation. We grow the sorority community through spring (formal) & fall recruitment (informal); host social, professional, and wellness events for the Panhellenic sorority community; and raise money for NPC’s philanthropy, the Circle of Sisterhood!

Summary: A South Asian Interest Fraternity involved in nurturing a culture of giving back to our community, raising money for our philanthropy (JDRF) and exemplifying leadership through all of our members.
Description: Delta Epsilon Psi (ΔΕΨ) is a South Asian interest social and service fraternity located in the United States. Delta Epsilon Psi Fraternity, Inc. was founded on October 1, 1998 at the University of Texas at Austin. The 18 founders formed the fraternity to provide a unified South Asian voice at the school. The purpose of Delta Epsilon Psi is to develop leadership qualities within its members by instilling within them the three pillars (Brotherhood, Discipline, and Commitment) upon which the fraternity was founded. Delta Epsilon Psi's philanthropies are research towards curing juvenile diabetes (type 1 diabetes) through the Juvenile Diabetes Research Foundation (JDRF), and supporting the National Marrow Donor Program. Delta Epsilon Psi boasts 31 chapters and colonies throughout the nation. Tau Chapter at NJIT is one of many in the northeast region, with some others being Kappa (NB), Xi (Drexel), Alpha Theta (NYIT), Alpha Delta (TCNJ), Alpha Eta (Binghamton), and Alpha Xi (UMD).

Description:
NJIT Thillana is NJIT's premier Indian classical dance team. Summary: The ASA at NJIT is an organization that strives to connect the Armenian Community here at NJIT, with people of all ethnicity and background. Our goal is to educate students about current state of affairs, culture, and the rich history of Armenia.
Description: The ASA (Armenian Students Association) at NJIT is an organization that strives to connect the Armenian Community here at NJIT, with people of all ethnicity and background. Our goal is to educate students about current state of affairs, culture, the rich history, as well as preparing our members for the future of Armenians. As a member of the ASA at NJIT, members will have hands on experience with culture such as cooking, dancing, and other forms of culture. Members of the club will also learn a lot about the rich Armenian History, as well as current state of affairs, in order to stay educated at all times, and is able to provide detailed and factual information to others that are curious. As a club, we strive to not only educate and learn, but to also contribute to the NJIT cultural community and create connections with said communities. Amongst all of these, amongst all Armenians across the globe, we strive for a free, united, and independent Armenia and Artsakh.

name: NJIT Skate Club
Summary: Come skate with the official NJIT skateboarding club 🛹
Description:
NJIT SBC is the official skateboarding club at NJIT. We encourage and aim to foster a fun and inclusive community of skaters on campus. The club mainly revolves around street, transition, and freestyle skateboarding, but anyone involved in other types of boarding/related hobbies can join.

Events: Although we are a skateboarding club, the activities of our club reach beyond just riding the board. We hope to collaborate with many organizations/students from those on the creative side who would like to have their art/design showcased in the form of stickers/graphics, to those on the engineering/design side, who would like to build their own skateable structures/objects in the makerspace. We of course also plan on holding skate events, such as tournament style games of SKATE, events where we teach people how to skate, and charity style events where skaters might have to land certain tricks for prizes.

Skate Videos: One of the most rewarding aspects of skateboarding is the ability to look back on how far you've come and what you've been able to accomplish. Recording skateboarding and skate videos are a big part of skateboarding, and for that reason we at NJIT SBC plan on making a semester video every semester to showcase what our members have been up to. We plan to hold a premiere for these videos where all students/staff/anyone who is interested can come watch the video.

Join our discord where you can ask any questions pertaining to skateboarding or just talk

Also join our GroupMe where we often text to meet up to skateboard

 

Watch the trailer for our newest video premiering in the beginning of the Spring 2024 semester!

The specific Representative positions are: one for each class year (Freshman - Senior), an Accelerated Student Rep, a Dean's Scholars Rep, a Transfer Rep (for students who transferred into Honors after being non-Honors), a Commuter Rep, and a Non-Honors Hall Resident Rep. All of our Representatives and Officers are happy to hear about any requests, comments, concerns, questions, or feedback you have about the Honors College or any of its programs or requirements!

name: Iranian Cultural Association
Summary: The population of Iranian students is growing at NJIT. Therefore, we decided to establish an association to recall our home and introduce ourselves to our foreign friends.
Description:
Iran or Persia has one of the oldest cultures in the world. Iran has directly influenced cultures and people, for instance, Italy, Macedonia, and Greece to the West, Russia to the North, the Arabian Peninsula to the South, and South and East Asia to the East. Iran has had a long and turbulent history and its location at the crossroads of Europe and Asia has resulted in many invasions and migrations.


There is evidence that Iran played a role in the emergence of civilization as far back as 10,000 years ago. In 553BC, Cyrus the Great established the first Persian Empire, which extended to Egypt, Greece, and Russia. Cyrus the Great is also well recognized for his achievements in human rights, politics, and military strategy, as well as his influence on both Eastern and Western civilizations. Having originated from Persis, roughly corresponding to the modern Iranian province of Fars, Cyrus has played a crucial role in defining the national identity of modern Iran.


Iran is located in southwest Asia. With an area of 635,932 square miles (1,647,063 square kilometers), Iran is slightly larger than the state of Alaska. A vast, dry plateau in the center of the country is encircled by a ring of snow-topped mountain ranges that cover about half of Iran's area. To the north and south are coastal lowlands. Iran has a total population of about 70 million people.


Iran's official language is Farsi, which is also known as Persian. Farsi is also spoken in parts of Turkey and Afghanistan. Many Iranians understand Arabic, the language of the Koran (the sacred text of Islam). The Azerbaijanis speak a Turkish dialect known as Azeri. The overwhelming majority of Iranians (about 98 percent) are Shi'ah Muslims. Shi'ah, one of the two schools of Islam, is the state religion.


The major secular holiday is Nowruz, the ancient Persian New Year. It takes place on March 21, which is also the first day of spring. In the cities, a gong is sounded or a cannon is fired to signal the beginning of the new year. Children are given money and gifts, and dancers perform at festivals.

There are several ancient festivals and ceremonies to be celebrated in Iran which has roots in the kindness and hospitality spirit of our ancestors. Each of these ceremonies is based on their beliefs and stories; some of which are mentioned hereunder:

 

Sizdah Bedar: Persian Festival of "Joy and Solidarity". The 13th and last day of Nowruz celebration. Because of the end of twelve days (a sample of twelve-month), they celebrate the 13th day as a new beginning of the next twelve month and it has no relations with the number 13 (as an unlucky number). It is celebrated outdoors along with the beauty of nature.

 

Mehregan: Festival of Mehr (or Mihr). A day of thanksgiving. It is a day in which everyone shows the Mehr or the love they have for each other and it is one of the most important days in the year.

 

Jashne Sade: A mid-winter feast to honor fire and to "defeat the forces of darkness, frost and cold" in which people gather around and build a fire so that they can receive good things from the fire and give the fire their incompleteness.

 

Yaldā Night (Shabe Chelle): The turning point. End of the longest night (darkness) of the year, and beginning of growing of the days (Lights). A celebration of Good over Evil. Also known as Shab-e Yaldā they have special nuts for that night. 

 

Sepandarmazgan: Day of Love, Friendship, and Earth in ancient Persian culture.

 

Chaharshanbe Suri: Festival of Fire, last Wednesday night in the Iranian Calendar year. It marks the importance of the light over the darkness, arrival of spring and revival of nature.


The population of Iranian students is growing at NJIT. Therefore, we decided to establish an association to recall our home and introduce ourselves to our foreign friends. It goes without saying, according to the recent problems like the travel ban and VISA difficulties, Iranian students in states are facing a heavy burden of homesickness beside a load of academic challenges. Therefore, the need of having a community to provide support to the new arrivals has become considerably more than before.


Additional goals of such an association are extending the communication with other nationalities, holding some of these fascinating ceremonies, introducing Iranian culture and society to the willing individuals. Hopefully, this association can play a significant role to provide students with a more confident, efficient, and cheerful life.

Summary: ACM SIGGRAPH's mission is to foster and celebrate innovation in Computer Graphics and Interactive Techniques.
Description: NJIT SIGGRAPH is a community where students interested in design through a digital medium can come and take part in activities that will strengthen their skills and industry connections. These events include discussions on design techniques, program tutorials, critique sessions, animation workshops, and more - all to continue cultivating the community of digital design students on campus. NJIT SIGGRAPH will be the hub of digital design knowledge, activity, and interactivity on and off campus, where students can be exposed to the professional field of design through interactions with the numerous design studios in the metropolitan area, representatives from well-established entertainment companies, educators who have started their own design businesses, etc. We strive to offer our students the strongest possible support network as they develop their projects and step into the professional world of design.

Spectrum is a student run organization at NJIT and a chapter of oSTEM Incorporated that focuses on developing the campus as an lgbtqia+ friendly environment and nurturing the community on campus to be politically and socially conscious of LGBT+ topics. Our objectives are:

Host and promote LGBT+ related events on and off campus.
Push our students toward community service locally and globally.
Hold discussions regarding past and current LGBT+ issues.

Description:
Our club utilizes CAD modeling to design prosthetics and prints them out using printing software and the Makerspace 3D printers. Members can partake in lessons and design sessions held during the semester to familiarize themselves with these programs. They will have the chance to design their own prosthesis and potentially use them for the final product that is delivered to clients. Previous experience is not required.

Please join our club Discord for more updates. We're looking forward to seeing you there!

name: Phi Sigma Kappa - Alpha Octaton

Description: Theta Chi is a resolute Fraternity founded in 1856 on the principle of friendship through mutual assistance. It gives its members a fulfilling experience socially and academically preparing them in their lives after college. The Epsilon Psi Charter continues to provide a helping hand to its community on and off campus, breaking the negative stigmas of Greek life.

name: Kappa Phi Gamma Sorority, Incorporated
Summary: Founded by 27 visionary women, Kappa Phi Gamma Sorority, Inc. was established on November 8th, 1998, at The University of Texas at Austin, as the Nation's first ever South Asian Interest-Based Sorority.
Description: Founded by 27 visionary women, Kappa Phi Gamma Sorority, Inc. was established on November 8th, 1998, at The University of Texas at Austin, as the Nation’s first ever South Asian Interest-Based Sorority. Although Kappa Phi Gamma was founded as a South Asian sorority, we have expanded the warmth of our Sisterhood to any and all motivated young women willing to make a difference in their community and to uphold the principles that the sisterhood is based upon. The Founders envisioned a sorority built around 8 principles: Character, Leadership, Scholarship, Sisterhood, Service, Culture, Womanhood, and Self. Realizing the quality of the Sisterhood could never be compromised, the Founders’ every endeavor thereafter was directed toward fostering these 8 principles and establishing a solid foundation for the future before embarking on plans for expansion. On May 18, 2016 five women chartered Sigma Charter at New Jersey Institute of Technology in Newark, New Jersey. Their mission is to spread the Sisterhoods' ideal principles for other women to embrace while continuing the vision of the National Founders.

name: Public Speaking Club
Summary: The purpose of the Public Speaking Club shall be to enhance NJIT students’ public speaking abilities, interpersonal skills, and interactions.
Description:
The purpose of the Public Speaking Club shall be to enhance NJIT students’ public speaking abilities, interpersonal skills, and interactions. The club shall provide opportunities to improve one’s self-confidence across all mediums of communication. This club will provides students who are interested in public speaking a community where they will be able to improve their interpersonal skills. The organization also provides opportunities to improve public speaking skills for students that cannot commit to and pay for a public speaking course such as Oral Presentations. Public speaking courses also put pressure on students since they are graded for how they perform in their course. Our club will not place pressure on any student and may only lead to friendly competitions. Through a friendly/casual environment, this organization will allow opportunities even for students that are not comfortable with public speaking.

Our mission, the Sanskar team is to foster belonging for Students away from their homes, while also promoting cross-cultural connections.
