Summary: Students for Life is an advocacy organization seeking to educate and engage the NJIT community about issues that threaten human life and provide support to community members who are personally facing these issues.
Description: Students for Life seeks to promote the dignity and protection of all human life from conception to natural death and to uphold and preserve corresponding values geared at the promotion and protection of human life. The club works to save lives threatened by induced abortion, euthanasia, infanticide, and the destruction of human embryos for research in all scenarios. In furtherance of these goals, members seek to promote respect for life at NJIT and on a local, state, and national level, to educate on life issues, to help those in need so that life is a promising choice, and to work with others who share common goals.

Description:
NJIT Highlanders Cricket is a student-run organization that promotes and facilitates the sport of cricket among the college community. Our club organizes opportunities for students to participate in cricket games, tournaments, and other related events. Club activities may include regular practices, friendly matches against other college cricket clubs, and participating in intercollegiate tournaments.

 

The primary objective of Highlanders Cricket Club is to provide a platform for students who are interested in playing cricket and promote the sport within the college community. The club may also organize coaching sessions, training camps, and workshops to improve the skills and techniques of the members.

 

Overall, joining this club is a great way for students to get involved in the sport, develop their skills, and build lasting relationships with other students who share a common interest in cricket.

Summary:
NOMAS
National Organization of Minority Architecture Students
Description: The National Organization of Minority Architecture Students (NOMAS) the New Jersey Institute of Technology Chapter has a mission to champion diversity within the education of design by promoting academic excellence, community engagement, networking, national conferences, and professional development of its members. A welcoming environment for minority architecture students where we can support and build each other up. A place to talk about real issues that might be affecting minority students in their studies and at the professional level.

name: The Murray Center for Women in Technology
Summary: The Murray Center is a university-wide network that connects women students and faculty to each other and to the resources they need to succeed.
Description:
The Center was established in 1995 to continue the work of the late Dr. Constance A. Murray (NJIT Dean of Students,1978-1994) a passionate advocate for diversity.  

Our Initiatives: A peer-to-peer support system for first year students. A professional network for graduate students. A nationally-recognized program to advance women faculty. 

Our Location: The 2nd Floor of the Campus Center. The Murray Center provides a quiet place to study, a lounge for relaxation with friends, computers, a library, a mini-kitchen, and two conference rooms for all students.

Description: We are the joint theatre program of NJIT and Rutgers-Newark, which trains students in applied theatre education: set, stage, light and sound design, playwriting, improvisational theatre techniques, music ensembles, directing, and performance.

name: Transition, Engagement, Access, & Mentorship (T.E.A.M.)
Summary: Transition, Engagement, Access, & Mentorship (T.E.A.M.) was developed to provide guidance and support for students with the overall goal of retention, persistence, and graduation.
Description:
Transition, Engagement, Access, & Mentorship (T.E.A.M.) was developed to provide guidance and support for students with the overall goal of retention, persistence, and graduation. This is realized through an affirming, learning-centered environment where students are equipped with information, motivation, and the agency needed to attain their academic and career goals.

T.E.A.M. Goals:

  • Connect students to resources internal and external to NJIT
  • Improve Engagement/Involvement in the NJIT community
  • Provide academic support and guidance
  • Create opportunities for career exploration & professional development
  • Promote the holistic development and wellness of students

name: Material Advantage of NJIT, Student Chapter
Summary: Material Advantage of NJIT, Student Chapter. We are a Student-Driven path to Materials Science Excellence. Join us and experience professional technical talks, unique networking opportunities, and meet fellow material scientists and engineers!
Description:
Material Advantage of NJIT, Student Chapter.

We are a Student-Driven path to Materials Science Excellence. Join us and experience professional technical talks, unique networking opportunities, and meet fellow material scientists and engineers.

 

Material Advantage Student Chapter at NJIT has a mission of dedication to the promotion of academic excellence, scholarship and professional development of undergraduate students. Being a member of Material Advantage NJIT provides students with amazing networking opportunities, enabling them to build a professional network with PHD students and working professionals before acquiring an undergraduate degree. Material Advantage NJIT also provides students memberships with four prestigious professional organizations which offers unlimited opportunities to expand their engineering knowledge base. Additionally, each of these four prestigious organizations provide Material Advantage NJIT members with real internship and career opportunities. Members are also provided with mentorship from professional engineers from four professional societies. The past activities of NJIT Material Advantage chapter provided students with technical talks and networking opportunities with professional engineers and faculty. Finally, professional plant Tours are organized each academic year.

name: Korean Student Association
Summary: Korean Student Association
Description:
Hello everyone! We are KSA, the Korean Student Association at NJIT. We are a cultural, student organization that fosters an inclusive environment for students passionate about Korean culture. We aim to provide a platform for students to share experiences, promote cultural appreciation, and celebrate traditions through diverse activities. KSA aims to unite undergraduate students and create a diverse and inclusive community at NJIT by emphasizing cultural awareness and acceptance.    

Join our discord! https://discord.gg/rSuyhdPg

name: Sigma Psi Kappa
Summary: Sigma Psi Kappa is a local social sorority founded in 1992 and based at the New Jersey Institute of Technology in Newark, NJ.
Description:
Sigma Psi Kappa is NJIT’s only local social sorority founded and based at the New Jersey Institute of Technology in Newark, NJ. We have been on campus since 1992 and have since grown to the organization you see today. We are fully recognized by the University and have maintained this status since 1993.

Out sisterhood is built upon the four main pillars of Greek Life: Scholarship, Service, Leadership, and Friendship. We also follow another set of 7 principles that guide us to be better sisters and above all, become better people.

The philanthropies Sigma Psi Kappa are known for are: the American Heart Association, which we hold semesterly Blood Drives for on-campus, the second philanthropy that we dedicate our time to is the Kaleidoscope of Hope, a New Jersey-based organization who raises awareness for Ovarian Cancer.
Aside from our hard work at school and for the community, we are a social organization that prides ourselves on our motto “Sisterhood by Friendship. We love spending time with each other, whether this is on out of state road trips or hanging out on a sister’s couch with a bag of popcorn. Sigma Psi Kappa is full of unique, exciting, and diverse sisters from across the globe who found each other through the sisterhood.

name: Minority Association of Pre-Health Students
Summary: MAPS is an association dedicated to serving NJIT students who are interested in any health-related profession, including medicine, dentistry, pharmacy, veterinary, osteopathic medicine, ophthalmology, and others.
Description: The Minority Association of Pre-Health Students is an association dedicated to serving New Jersey Institute of Technology students who are interested in any health-related profession; including medicine, dentistry, pharmacy, veterinary, osteopathic medicine, ophthalmology, and others. Our goal is to help make the professional health field more diverse by providing opportunities to students belonging to underrepresented groups in medicine. By providing information on admissions, shadowing, internships, scholarships, preparation in standardized exams and community service opportunities we hope to increase the number of minority students applying and getting accepted into professional health schools.

name: The Lisa A. Pierce Center for Leadership
Summary: The Lisa A. Pierce Center for Leadership was established in 2004 by the Student Senate, the Dean of Students, and the Vice President of Student Affairs as a resource for college student development.
Description:
The Lisa A. Pierce Center for Leadership is named after a NJIT staff member whose passion for Leadership Development has transcended past their tenure.

Her strong desire to promote student leadership was exemplified when she created the Center for Leadership. Lisa brought energy and light to the room. She was fun, lighthearted, charismatic, and loved by many. When her colleagues created the "Fun Committee,", she was on board ready to plan parties, gatherings, and trips to watch local bands. While Lisa Ann Pierce may not be with us anymore, that same passion is what drives the Center forward.

Follow us on Instagram: @lifeatnjit

name: The Minerva (NJIT Creative Writing Club)
Summary: The Minerva is a community for students to creatively express themselves through writing, share personally written literature with like-minded individuals, and have a chance to publish their written works.
Description:
The Minerva is a community for students to creatively express themselves through writing, share personally written literature with like-minded individuals, and have a chance to publish their written works.

Creative writing can not only serve as a way to unwind but a way to keep your mind active, be it by crafting stories, worlds, and narratives, or by letting poems spring forth from your mind. Within The Minerva, you will find many individuals who will not only help you along your journey of creation but appreciate and admire your work.

On top of this, not only will students be able to publish their works in a yearly publication, but working hand in hand with The Vector, students can put their works in our college's own newspaper for all to see.

Whether you're looking to spread your written word to students on campus and beyond, or looking for a quiet place to write in comfort, The Minerva is the place for you.

name: MedicZero
Summary: MedicZero

name: Center for Counseling and Psychological Services
Summary: The NJIT Center for Counseling and Psychological Services (C-CAPS) is staffed by psychologists and professional counselors who are here to help students with the transitions and stresses of college life as well as with more serious psychological problems
Description:
Personal challenges such as stress, anxiety, depression, relationships and low self-esteem can impact academic and personal functioning. 

Counseling may help you to identify and explore available options, increase self-awareness and make realistic decisions about concerns that may be distracting you from achieving your personal and academic goals.  Speaking with a professional can increase a students’ ability to achieve a sense of clarity and in turn regain a sense of empowerment to make decisions that feel right. 

C-CAPS provides a safe, non-judgmental and highly confidential environment where students can meet with a professional to discuss any discomfort or concerns they may have.  For situations or conditions that require more comprehensive or longer-term services than the C-CAPS offers, we will assist students with referrals to off-campus providers.

In addition to counseling, C-CAPS offers a number of other services.  These include workshops on topics such as test anxiety, stress management, and assertiveness; CLEP tests for eligible students seeking credit by examination for certain core courses and pre-law information.

Confidentiality Statement

Confidentiality and trust are very important to the counseling process.  Therefore, except as described below, the information disclosed during counseling and the identity of counseling clients will not be shared with anyone outside C-CAPS without the client’s express (usually written) consent.  This confidentiality extends to situation in which a client is referred to C-CAPS by a faculty member, administrator, or friend.

However, exceptions to confidentiality may be necessary or be required by law when the C-CAPS professional believes there is risk of harm to yourself, other individual(s), or the university community; in cases of medical emergency; in situations involving probable child abuse; or other legal mandate.  Should that occur, relevant information may be disclosed only to university personnel and/or others with responsibility for protecting safety or with legal jurisdiction.

Situations involving exceptions to confidentiality occur infrequently.  We encourage you to talk with a staff counselor or psychologist if you have concerns about this.

name: Society of Musical Arts
Summary: We are the student leaders of the Music Initiative. Focused on building the program and hosting music-based events (i.e. concerts, open mic nights, etc.). We welcome anyone who wants to perform, sing, or jam out, on and off campus.
Description:
The Society of Musical Arts (SOMA) is the musical presence in NJIT. The organization is home to three instrumental ensembles, and a plethora of student run independent groups and bands that perform for events around campus and off campus. These events range from athletic events for the campus’ sports teams to scholarship luncheons. Our main goal is to spread the opportunity to perform music and to give the students of this campus a stress-relieving and hospitable environment and ample resources to do so.

To chat, get updates on our events, or ask any questions, join our Discord!

name: Society of Hispanic Professional Engineers
Summary: The Society of Hispanic Professional Engineers (SHPE) changes lives by empowering the NJIT community to realize their fullest potential and impacts the world through STEM awareness, access, support, and development.
Description:
SHPE Holds professional events throughout the semesters to help students grow professionally and prepare them for the corporate world.

SHPE also focus on maintaining a family bond with members to provide a support system through their journey in college.

Description:
Hello! Bienvenidos!

HACCS is committed to cultivating a strong community, encouraging cultural awareness, and providing resources to empower members as they pursue successful careers in computing. We also facilitate professional development opportunities for members.

 

We strive to enhance the college experience and professional development of Hispanic/Latine students at the Ying Wu College of Computing (YWCC). Yet, all NJIT students interested are welcome to stop by!

name: Vietnamese Student Association
Summary: Vietnamese Student Association
Description:
Established in 2024, we are a community of students who share an interest in Vietnamese culture, traditions, and language. Our goal is to promote cultural awareness and appreciation, as well as to foster a community for Vietnamese students and any other students interested in Vietnamese culture.

Whether you are Vietnamese or simply interested in learning more about the culture, we welcome you to join us. As a member of our club, you will have the opportunity to participate in a variety of events and activities, including: creating art, cooking traditional Vietnamese foods, fundraisers, cultural holidays, guest speaker events and much more!

Be sure to join our discord! https://discord.gg/YseZsnCpk6

name: Robotics Club
Summary: The NJIT Robotics Club is a student-run group of highly motivated students who share a common passion for the field of robotics. This diverse group brings together a wide variety of skills to design, build, program, and test robots. Also host to VEX U.
Description:
Join Our Discord: njit.gg/robotics


The NJIT Robotics Club is a student-run group of highly motivated students who share a common passion for the field of robotics. With majors ranging from mechanical engineering to computer science, this diverse group brings together a wide variety of skills to design, build, program, and test robots. The robotics club is also host to our award winning VexU robotics team.

The Robotics Club is the ideal place for any level of robotics enthusiast to learn new skills and apply their skills in novel and challenging environments. Any student can become a Project Manager and lead a project of their own. Alternatively, they can join an existing project they like and learn new skills or apply what they already know. In addition to team building and project management, which is at the core of any successful endeavor, we utilize a number of technical skills. For designing robots, some popular choices are Autodesk Inventor and Fusion 360 because they are provided free to students. But we also provide training and support for many other programs such as AutoCAD, Solidworks, and Creo Parametric. Additionally, we believe that the best way to learn is by doing, which is why we support many avenues to prototyping, including free 3D printing for all members and strong connections with the Makerspace. In addition to the mechanical aspect of robotics, programming is a key component to a successful robot. Some of the common programming languages that we teach and use in projects are C/C++, Python, VBA, Shell Script, and more.

For more details, please see our Club Discord: njit.gg/robotics

Club Public Google Drive (Find useful documents here!): njit.gg/robotics-docs

name: Women in Computing Society
Summary: NJIT Undergraduate Women in Computing Society (WiCS) promotes and supports NJIT's growing community of women studying in the fields of computing and technology.
Description:
✨ Welcome to the NJIT Undergraduate Women in Computing Society (WiCS), dedicated to fostering a vibrant community of women pursuing studies in computing and technology at NJIT. WiCS offers a range of opportunities for members to enhance their skills, connect with industry professionals, and contribute to our community. ✨

 

✨ As a member of WiCS, you'll have access to student and company-led workshops, informative sessions, and office tours hosted by leading tech companies, exhilarating hackathons (GirlHacks), networking events at national conferences (Grace Hopper Celebration), and opportunities for community service. ✨


🚀 Stay informed about our upcoming events and meetings by joining our mailing list!

🚀 Connect with fellow WiCS members and stay up-to-date on all the latest news and events by joining our Discord server!

🚀 Follow and Interact with us on Instagram and Linkedin! Feel free to tag us!

 

Join us in shaping the future of computing and technology, and let's thrive together in this exciting field!

 

New E-Board Position Available - Technical Director! Join our Team! http://bit.ly/wics-tech-director

Summary: We are a club comprised of both old and new players who look for good games to play and enjoy either casual or competitive badminton. We wish to provide a place without regard for weather, the need to drag equipment around, or to commit. Just have fun!
Description:
We are a club that offers a welcoming space to badminton players of all skill levels. We hope to guide new players and brush off the rust with veteran players with our weekly sessions. If you would like to keep up to date with information regarding our club, you can join us at https://discord.gg/3GdHT5ruMp.

name: Albert Dorman Honors College
Summary: Honors Scholars map their future through Honors courses, colloquia, study tours, research experiences, service learning, dual degree and study abroad programs, a variety of accelerated degree partnerships, and internships.
Description:
The Albert Dorman Colloquium Series focuses on the interface between Science, Technology and Society. Colloquia normally meet during university common hours 10-15 times each semester. They feature talks by - and conversations with - industry, academic, and government leaders on a wide range of topics. Field trips to corporate, scientific, cultural, and community organizations are also included. In addition, some important campus political and cultural events are co-sponsored by the Honors College and regarded as part of the Colloquium Series.

Honors students must attend at least 2 colloquia each semester and are strongly encouraged to attend more than the required amount.

Description: The Office of Student Transition (OST) is committed to providing all the information and resources you need to transition smoothly to NJIT and be academically successful. Description: CaribSO's mission is to implement a Caribbean experience through knowledge, food, song, and dance; to educate students on Caribbean history and culture; to bring people of different backgrounds together while enjoying what each other have to offer; and to contribute to the diversity and culture of NJIT's campus.

Description: Tikkun Olam Makers (TOM) NJIT is an organization dedicated to bringing together a community of students at NJIT that work towards helping create affordable and accessible technologies to those in need. name: Archery Club
Summary: We strive to provide a safe, accessible, and fun opportunity for all students to enjoy and explore the sport of archery.
Description:
At the NJIT Archery Club, our mission is to strive to provide a safe, accessible, and fun opportunity for all students to enjoy and explore the sport of archery.

If that sounds like something you would be interested in, come to one of the events or meetings we host, or head down to one of our practices at the range with other members.

 

Our Practice Schedule for the Spring 2024 semester is: 

 

Wednesday: 12:00pm-2:00pm
Thursday: 1:00pm-3:30pm
Friday: 12:00pm-3:30pm
Sunday: 1:00pm-4:00pm

 

Location/ Directions: We will be meeting in the Group Fitness room. The room is the first room on the left when you enter the WEC (Wellness and Events Center) through the entrance by Tiernan Hall.

 

Items/ Equipment: None Needed! The club will provide archery equipment(bows, arrows, protective gear) to every member. 

 

The General Body Meetings are on an As-Needed Basis

The most up-to-date information along with any practice cancellations can be found on our discord server.

Discord Server: https://njit.gg/archery

Hope to see you at practice soon!

name: Black Student Union
Summary: Black Student Union aka BSU creates an intersectional space for students of all backgrounds and personalities to engage, flourish and celebrate Black culture as a community and a found family.
Description:
At the Black Student Union (BSU), our purpose is to create a vibrant community that celebrates African American culture and heritage. We believe in the power of diversity, bringing together individuals from various backgrounds to learn, connect, and thrive. we curate a rich tapestry of events, workshops, and discussions that illuminate African American history, art, and cultural traditions. Through educational initiatives, we delve into our shared heritage, fostering a deeper understanding and promoting cultural exchange.

As passionate advocates, we amplify the voices of black students on campus, addressing their concerns and navigating challenges. Our dialogue extends beyond our union—we collaborate with fellow student organizations, actively championing racial equity and social justice. BSU is a breeding ground for empowered leaders. We believe that leadership drives positive change. Within our safe haven, black students express themselves freely, find unwavering support, and forge lasting connections.

name: First Love NJIT
Summary: We are an organization that aims to benefit the NJIT community by helping members understand Christianity , as well as use their gifts and talents through our Creative Art Groups. Enjoy the Film Stars, Dancing Stars, Rap Stars and Choirs.

name: Habitat for Humanity
Summary: NJIT Habitat for Humanity works to provide volunteers to help build affordable housing for people in need, allowing for students at NJIT to participate in the Newark community and beyond.
Description:
Habitat for Humanity is an international organization that helps organize, design, and construct affordable housing for people in need. At NJIT Habitat for Humanity, our main purpose is to send students to build sites, primarily with Habitat for Humanity of Greater Newark, to volunteer their time in construction and building tasks. Some of these tasks include painting walls, nailing down floor boards, sanding wood, etc. There is no experience necessary to attend our build sites, as there are always contractors or officials on site and safety equipment provided! It is an amazing experience to physically help people in need, and also a great opportunity for external volunteering hours for those who may need them. We also do lots of fundraisers and events for volunteers!

Feel free to join our Discord to keep in touch, follow our Instagram account (@njit_habitat4humanity), and welcome to the club!


Join our Discord here!

Summary: The Student Activities Council provides recreational and social activities for NJIT students and other members of the NJIT community.
Description:
The Student Activities Council can be summed up in one statement: Less stress, More FUN! We are a group of fun-loving and ambitious students who desire to make an impact at NJIT. We do this by planning and hosting engaging experiences throughout the semester, aimed at bringing the campus community together.

 

Interested in creating new experiences for the campus community? We are always looking for people to join our team and help us make a difference at NJIT. With your help, we can make your vision a reality. Email sac@njit.edu if you are interested. Or stop by our office, located at the Campus Center, Room 476. We look forward to hearing from you!

 

      Our Values:

  • Students: We offer opportunities for students to relax and cope with the stress of college.
  • Feedback: We want to hear what students have to say about us, good or bad.
  • Innovation: We push the boundaries of what we do, always trying to find the next big event.
  • Collaboration: We partner with other campus organizations to produce high-quality events for all.

Come and try it out!!

Thursdays from 8:30pm in the Game Room

name: Sigma Alpha Epsilon
Summary: Sigma Alpha Epsilon
Description: The Fraternity’s mission is advancing the highest standards of friendship, scholarship, leadership and service for our members throughout life.
